review:
This is a great health related medical app that’s extremely easy to use and a much better option than a box of papers you file away. It’s convenient and you’ll find that your medical information is simple a tap away, whenever you need it, anytime, anywhere.  It helps you to stay on top of all your medical care and the costs. I appreciate the ability to be able to keep an eye on my share of cost, health related billing, and deductibles. 

I only have one request in that it is nice that I am able to share your medical ID card as a pdf, but it would be much better if you allowed the medical ID card to be downloaded into my Apple Wallet along with my other cards. I have my prescription related card, along with my roadside assistance and groceries store cards, the time is now to allow the medical ID card to be utilized with the same convenience. 

Nevertheless, the am ranking this app 4.5 out of 5 stars. Great work!!
title: Great Health Related App

review: I have had nothing but problems with my navigator returning phone calls since October or December 2021 it is now March 16, 2022 and I still haven’t heard from her there’s something wrong with your phone system so she says plus then I’ve tried to talk to supervisors they were supposed to call me back has not won did and then she didn’t call me back after she said she would call me back at all I’ve tried to get back a hold of certain people can’t get a hold of anyone and nothing has been done can you please call me today to get things taken care of thank you I appreciate it and I don’t like this app I’m not sure how to really use it plus in January and I did not get my January $75 on my card and was promised because I got my card late I got my card on February 5, 2022 which was a Saturday and I was told and so was one of the customer service people or supervisor at UNITED Health Care to complete told that I would be getting an extension because I’m getting my card late and still I have not got that $75 for January February I didn’t try to use the card and it wouldn’t even work so now I got something else and I still don’t have my card in the mail which is the card number I got now don’t even know why what’s going on so I need somebody call me thank you have a nice day
title: Having problems with the card plus people not returning calls

review: Love that I can see my claims and Rx from the past. But when you need to add notes to your prescriptions there’s a glitch where the keyboard is in the way of the save button and there’s no way of pulling the keyboard down out the way. And they removed the ability to search for a specific doctor by name to see if they are in your network. I had to search a LONG list of several hundred drs and they are listed in no particular order. Just random so you can’t even scroll alphabetically. I swear I seen a dr was in network before contacting her to set up a surgery. But then when I contacted customer service to check on the pre-authorization and get an estimated out of pocket cost I was told she wasn’t in my network and they couldn’t give me an estimate. I went to try and find her in the search again but got tired of scrolling through hundreds of drs and without the ability to search by name it would have taken hours. Now I have learned if I find a dr in the list to take a screenshot of the list and their info. And since they changed things around it was hard to find the section that gives you an estimate out of pocket cost for procedures or for anything.
title: Great app till you actually need to do or look up something Specific

review:
Searching for a healthcare provider using this app is a nightmare. Good luck searching for a specific provider.  Is it under doctors, Specialists, facilities? Who knows! And good luck to you trying to figure it out. Not as simple as just entering a search term and seeing what results match your inquiry like a normal search engine with other insurance companies. 
To top it off, once you find a list of potential providers, make sure you go through them quickly before the app decides to log you out and you have to sign in and start over halfway through your review. 
But, that also depends if the app decides to let you log in at all. Depending on its mood it may log you in or it may tell you that your record wasn’t found, despite using FaceID linked to the same password that’s always worked for you. 
But worst of all, I was able to save a list of all my health providers for easy reference which you’d think is great. Well, that is until the app decided to one day delete all my saved providers so that I had to look for them all over again using their terrible search engine and save them again. Who knows how long they’ll last in my Saved bucket this time. 
I hate this app so much I have basically just resigned myself to using the desktop version.
title: Terrible glitchy app

review: The app allows you to view claims your providers have submitted to the insurer. Some of the claims are eye opening and will surprise you - such as how many claims a single visit might entail. You have the opportunity to mark-off which ones have been paid to assist the insurer to track whether your deductible has been reached. The app also allows you to quickly check which providers are in-network. Prescriptions on OptumRx are managed on a separate app. You can also save the contacts of your regular doctors for easy reference. It will also prompt you to look after your health by getting your blood pressure taken, getting a lipid panel or getting a flu shot. However, you do not put anything personal into the app. It does not collect your health data, so that’s good from a privacy perspective, but if that’s what you’re looking for, you’ll need another app.
title: Convenient, easy-to-use and useful

review:
I will say that I have been very impressed this app. I have had BCBC and Cigna’s apps, and by far UHC has been the most functional and user friendly for me! 

I have only been using it since September 2019 when my benefits switched. All I can say is I never missed a beat and have not had to call UHC for anything to date! For me this alone has me smiling!

I give it 5 stars, but I am great at updating my reviews if and when my experience or thoughts change! Keep it operating properly and don’t try to improve or change it if it’s not broken. Too many companies do this and someone needs to say enough at times! When ease turns to frustration say good bye to things that affect your bottom line!!
title: Best experience I’ve had healthcare apps!

review: I love that all my information is at my fingertips including my HSA balance. Very easy to add your doctors that are in network. However I find it annoying that I could not add an out of network physician as my GP. My GP is a PAC, I honestly have never even met the doctor listed on my scripts (who happens to be in-network). I think a seamless integration with MyChart and GoodRX should be something the developers should look into for a one stop shop with appointment scheduling, test results, and medication cost options. As it is now, the user interface is clean and easy to navigate without more than a couple of minutes poking around when you first use it. If you a falling apart like me and have frequent office visits and multiple doctors, it’s a handy app to keep your insurance information and claims in order.
title: Very convenient

review:
This app is very useful and I find myself using it frequently.  It is well-designed and relatively intuitive; for starters it is Faced ID-enabled so I don’t have to go looking for my userid and password every time.  It was also smart enough to look up both my current policy and one from a previous job so I can check my full history.  All of my recent claims are here and there are quick links to contact the nurse line, find a nearby provider, or talk directly to UHC.

It would get five stars except for two things: there’s no way to initiate a claim from the app (you have to use the full desktop site) and there seems to be no way to integrate with any medical records (for example, it keeps suggesting that I get my flu shot, even though I got it during a covered visit).

Overall, though, it’s a very solid app.
title: Quality Health Care App

review: Off and on for the past 2, years, I have been jumping through hoops to take care of multiple, as in at least 20 billing and coding errors, that result in me getting charged hundreds of dollars each tim, when it should be covered 100%. I am being charged as a home infusion, when I have NEVER, EVER had a home infusion my whole life. I have always gotten my infusions at an infusion center. I have also had my IVIG delivered to my house, instead of the infusion center, and they had to return to pick it up. I just received another notification today, saying another IVIG  delivery will be arriving tomorrow. It’s never ending. I have been told over and over and over that it will be red flagged, and I won’t have to worry about it anymore. I have even spoken to my Patient Navigator. This is very stressful, and not good for my health, as stress is a HUGE factor in the possibility of a relapse related to my autoimmune disorder.
title: IVIG Delivery, billing errors, and coding errors

review:
I wanted to say how helpful the UHC rep. Natalie from Columbus, Ohio was last Friday, April 15th. She stayed on the phone with me for over an hour assisting with talking to my current ENT Dr.’s office that was going to do my ear surgery, trying to convince them to pick up UHC/AARP insurance. She was trying to save me money! Researching Network doctors and finding one for me. She connected me with the rep. At the Essentials Account to order diabetic testing supplies, staying on the line until the order was completed. She explained in detail to me what the Essentials account was. I believe she went above and beyond any reps in other insurances normally do! 
Thanks Natalie! 

Gail C. Sheldon
St. Marys, Penna.
title: Dedicated UHC Employee

review:
Why is my previous review deleted Apple??
Same complaint about UHC as before… stopping all promotional emails is not possible. The “opt out” button is non working or fake. It doesn’t do any good to block emails (or unsubscribe) within the Gmail app because UHC periodically uses different addresses to send from… just like scam callers constantly change their phone #.
I don’t believe I want to do business with UHC anymore since this is a representation of how they do all of their business. I’m going to shop around next enrollment time. I’m also going to pass this onto all the FB sites and pages (including a 1400 friend list to pass on) concerning the relentless pursuit of customers when they choose not to be solicited. I’ll be making a reminder in my phone, along with a copied & pasted of this review, to check this review every month to make sure it’s still here. Time to go block yet another email address
title: Not again?

review: I downloaded this app about a year ago. As far as the app itself is concerned, I was pleased with it. I didn’t need it for a while until today; when I tried to log in to resolve an insurance mixup, I was denied entry. After spending some time checking my email and password, I came to the App Store to see if I could get some info here. That’s when I learned that some time during the interim the UHC app was no longer usable by AARP Medicare Advantage/UHC customers. I will be deleting this app - why should I keep something I can’t use? - and I understand UHC has the right to simplify things on their end, but it would have been nice to have received some warning of the change BEFORE I had to use it. The app itself gets five stars; the lack of communication dropped it to three.
title: Changed without warning

review: I am very impressed with what I see, it’s great for staying in the loop of things as they are processing, I love that  I could see everything and everyone that I seen or visit with, perfect and the charges are broken down so you can see everything, if your life is very busy and you have to keep thing organized this is what you need, you can make notes on each claim and keep it all together with that claim. I finally was able to register and log on today after trying for a couple weeks and I’m so glad I’m up and running with it. Stress defuser, peace of mind is where it help me to be....Thanks
title: Awesome New Organizer!

review:
No customer service. I needed help with this app as it didn’t work with my iphone. I called the technical assistance number and got a person who only does commercial UHC, however she sent me to someone who “could help me”. That person asked me several questions and had me repeat the same actions I had just done and declared my phone incompatible with this app. Interesting, since my wife had just downloaded the same app on her identical ios phone with no problem. ( no problem getting into the web site on the laptop). 
Then he said he’d get someone who knew this app “really well”. Isn’t that why I was connected to him in the first place? Should I ask for the janitor next? I hung up after receiving NOTHING from UHC after almost 1.5 hours on the phone. I did receive many insincere ear massage apologies though.
title: Terrible

review:
I used the UHC APP to check on my claims. I have been to the hospital due to COVID19 and was very ill so I just want to make sure that all the Dr’s (heroes for me) that took care of me get paid. When checking the claims see the pulmonologist & ambulance didn’t get paid. Right on the app have choices to take care the claims , for me I like to speak with someone not a machine so you can request a call right away or you have the choice for UHC to call you back. That is a nice figure to have I tried out, requested a representative spoke with then and got both of the claims fix. I recommend the UHC app. 

Thanks you
title: First time user

review:
This is a great app. It makes things so much easier. You can access your is card. The app provides you your recent EOB’s as well as your deductible amount and how much money has been applied toward it based on your medical visits.

The best thing about this app is you can search for a specific procedure. This allows you to view the doctors in the area you live or nearby. You see the doctors name as well as reviews. It will show you what the doctor charges and gives a detailed breakdown of what you will pay out of pocket with explanations. You can use this to “shop” different doctors for a lower cost.
Excellent app.
title: Great App

review: Wow! This app actually gives a clear representation of my insurance plan, deductibles, co-pays, and what has already been charged to those areas. Don't expect another low-tech, non functioning med insurance app. My experience is that I have direct information, updated within a few days to a week of service. Also like the in-network doctor near me finder. I have three children, ages 5 and younger, and we like to travel. Knowing that I can find a close-by in-network provider for the inevitable sniffles, bug bites, and upset stomachs that come with traveling with children, is peace of mind!
title: Clarity in medical insurance? It’s true!!

review:
(This is his wife writing this review)

So we just used the call a nurse 24hrs and I couldn’t be happier with how it turned out. She was so nice, helpful, answered all of our questions and even the ones we didn’t ask. She also told us about another option that they offer and where to look for it on the website to see if that will help us as well. 

Oh.. and when we put in to talk to a nurse I don’t think we even closed the app fully before my cell phone was ringing. Great turnaround and awesome nurse. I will definitely use this again whenever someone is sick again.
title: Sick 6 months old

review: Submitting a claim has never been easier! However, after I took photos of the required documents and submitted the claim I realized I entered the incorrect date and I couldn’t find a way to go back to make this change after submitting the claim. Now I need to make a phone call during normal business hours.  It would be nice if I could go back to see what I submitted and make that simple correction but I don’t think that’s possible.  Complications resulted from user error. Aside from that it gets 5 stars.
title: So Easy To Submit A Claim, but...

review: I have had issues with some of the providers you have on your site under this plan.  I have found addresses and phone numbers to not only be incorrect but also belonging to completely different businesses.  I have provided this information to your representatives but have seen no changes.  I have been looking for a counselor and not a single one on your site has returned my calls, or the phone/address on your site is completely wrong.  You need to fix this.  It makes looking for a provider super difficult.  I am considering switching plans at the end of this year.
title: You need to update your site

review: I’m very thankful to be one of the few that are covered with dual insurance is having this has made my life and choosing to go to the doctor much easier! Are used to fear about not having money to pay for all the bills to find out that you have kidney disease, carpal tunnel in both wrists, And sleep apnea. There a Tonna test they have to be done from watching your blood pressure and checking your cholesterol to seeing how many white blood cell count you have. Thank you for being with me in the beginning of this progress!
title: My primary insurance! Secondary insurance is through mail handler‘s benefit plan

review:
This app is so easy to use. It shows all you need to know about those providers around you. It has ratings by them, how close they are, what services they render, on top of that how much you will be spending! It’s awesome because then for those that are out you can know what to expect when you get there.

Reviews on the app are weird because it shows the ratings per provider but they don’t show what their patients are saying. However, I am unsure if it’s for HIPAA compliance. I mean I would like to see what people are saying to really know whether to go there or not.
title: Simple

review: I like this app. It helps me keep up with my billing. The only one thing I’ve noticed is going from my desktop to the app my paid items that I checked do not change over when I mark them. Kind of a problem if your trying to remember and can’t get to your desktop. Other than that, I was able to update my primary care doctor and check in on my claims against my insurance. I noticed Labcorp doesn’t comply with the payment feature so I’ll have to contact them directly.
title: Very helpful and easy to navigate

review: I downloaded the app and had my two college children download it as well. Since neither really carry wallets, I thought it would be a good way for them to have quick access to the insurance cards if needed. The problem is there are six people in our plan so one child is printed on a separate card that is not visible on the app. I called in to UHC to see if there was a way to view all persons covered via the app. The agent that I spoke to was less than helpful and sarcastic. I will not name her in this review, but if someone cares enough to reach out to me, I will certainly share the name and details about the encounter. You all should consider an update that makes all details assessable on the app. If not then what’s the point? It’s not convenient or helpful if it’s missing important information.
title: Poor design
body: Hi! We value your feedback and are sorry to hear about your experience. Please reach out to us at uhcmobile@uhc.com so we can better assist you.

review: Most of the app works very well technically but has a fundamental flaw for families. The app will only allow the primary to see information related to the dependents or the HSA balance. In our case, my wife handles most of our children’s healthcare needs but because she is not the primary she can’t see any information related to them through the app nor can she see the HSA balance when she is the one primarily using the account. We understand the need for privacy but there should be a way to join the accounts after giving permissions (there’s not - we called). So this app is great for single people but useless for administration of family plans.
title: Good App but not Great for Families

review: I can view claims, show my insurance card, look up doctors in my area by name or by condition of health ailments! If I’m unsure of a doctor to see due to a new condition the app can show me in 2 seconds all my options for my area, used to take me 10 minutes at least or I’d have to schedule with a mystery doctor based off their practice alone. It also has a health checklist so that I know what I’m staying on top of and what I’m not, so I don’t have to guess or try to figure out via the clinic if I need a immunization or a test/screening done. This is great!
title: Amazing!

review: I recently downloaded the app and was very pleased with it at first sight, until I started to download other similar apps for different insurance types and realized that all the other apps allow me to save my ID cards to my “wallet” fiction on apple iPhone except for this one . I really like the idea of having all my yards on my phone at all times but this app simply doesn’t have that feature. I hope they add it soon it’s a great feature to have . Other than that I have no complaints !
title: Really like it but is missing a feature

review: This app is so easy to use. I love that I can check which doctors and facilities are in or out of network. I’m very happy with how fast claims show up and all the information that accompanies each claim. I would definitely get this app if you have UH. Of course you cannot see everything such as your deductible/OOP/copays but I know what they are anyway so it’s not a big deal to me. Having your card available all the time is a big bonus especially if your traveling or have a last minute emergency.
title: Love the ease

review: If you need help or have questions that need to be answer you have your nurse and a doctor just a phone/app call away... instead of waiting close to a month for an appointment or having to wait for hours or pay high cost for ER visits and have to make runs to your local pharmacy, everything is done by a click and best part at your privacy of your own home/space.... Have been using it twice so far and I well recommend this... please give it a try
title: Very convenient

review: I love this app! Never have I been able to do so much with an app. I love that I can find doctors quickly, seek out information about providers, find all the contact info and even speak to someone at United Healthcare via phone or video chat outside of my doctors regular office hours if I have a concern. I love the accurate, to the minute information about the funds in my accounts and what I’ve spent/ what is left. This app makes finding the help I need very easy.
title: Super easy to access my healthcare info!

review:
I walk 7 to 10,000 steps about 20 days a month. Because of a programming glitch and being unable to update my step count within the app I lost three months worth of rewards from United healthcare. Even though my history is plainly with in my health section on my Apple phone this app will not allow me to go back to prior months to correct the issue that was caused by their programming error. I called support several times and was told tough luck on you.  

If I go into an area on their app where it says update step count, and it does not work, I should not be penalized. #RipOff
title: I lost $30 because of this ap

review: Every time I call United Healthcare I get representatives that don’t know how to answer my questions. They Go round and round about with their generic answers without even addressing my question because it’s clear they don’t know what they’re. They Put me on hold for a long amount of time. My most recent call I was on for an hour and 40 minutes with three different representatives; the third one put me in the same department as the 1st. It’s just unacceptable and unprofessional. It’s horrible having United Health as an insurance company and I’m currently speaking up our companies HR since UH can’t help. If there was a negative star option I would choose that.
title: Frustrating and clueless representatives

review: Have had Cigna insurance forever. My husbands employer decided to change to UnitedHealthcare. This app falls way short compared to Cigna. You can not view an EOB on the app. Really? If you have a health reimbursement account the only person who can view this is the person that carries the insurance. You can’t view from any other family members app. On Cigna you could view all family members info. in one place , EOBs , HRA balance, everything. Y’all need to follow Cigna’s lead on this one. This is the most annoying app on my phone. You need to get some IT people in there to streamline all accounts in one place . It should be a choice if you want account info. together or separately.
title: Not as good as Cigna

review: Helpful but could be better.  If there are incorrectly filed claims that have been reprocessed the old claims still populate your list.  There doesn’t seem to be a way to hide them or move or remove them.  Also, I have requested that the note field in the app be fixed with no response.  You can enter a note but due to the keyboard covering the save button there isn’t any way to finish the note.
title: Still can’t write a note

review: This is the best medical benefits app I’ve ever used. It is easy to use and provides pretty much what I need for medical benefits support. Suggestions for improvements to go from best to stellar - the dental and vision support is not nearly as strong as the medical side of things but I think that’s reflective of UHC being a superstar on the medical side and being less than that on the dental and vision side of things. Always room to get even better than the best!
title: Easy to use and useful

review: I downloaded the app so I could easily pull up my ID cards.  I can login just fine on my computer, but the app repeatedly tells me it can’t find my credentials, or my password is wrong.  I’ve reset my password, again I can successfully login on my computer, but the app continues to fail.  Absolutely awful.  In addition, when doing a verification, it won’t send me a text, it fails every time as well.  Ridiculous for a healthcare company to not offer a convenient way to get your own healthcare information that you pay them for!  Fix the app or lose my business - tired of paying for you to make my life more complicated!
title: App login fails repeatedly

review: This app works wonderfully and is a great resource to me. I use it to when looking for a specific condition to be treated or for care near me. I like that everything from claims, preventive suggestions (health checklist), a copy of my insurance card, and prescriptions are all in one place. The app also allows you to shop around for prescription prices but will redirect you to another website for actual purchase. I recommend it!
title: Great resource

review: This app is awful when it comes to searching for a provider. There is little to know information about the provider. The website for the provider isn’t even attached. Most of the time when I search the provider online I can’t find them or they have 3 different addresses for their practice. The app should provide links to the provider website and keep the addresses up to date. I shouldn’t have to spend hours going back and forth trying to research the provider and getting no where. I’m trying to get help but can barely find a provider that actually matches the lists they provide. It’s ridiculous.
title: A joke

review: UHC made $11 billion in net income last year yet their new iPhone app doesn’t include the basic ability to read your own messages! I got an email saying they finally replied to one of my many questions and decided to download the app, hoping it would be easier the horrid site. The app is fine but where are my messages?? It doesn’t include the ability to even read them. Also it asks for your location and then immediately sends it to Foursquare. What about my HIPPA rights? More reprehensible service. Everyone working at this company “making the trains run on time” should be ashamed at their participation in profiting off the death and misery foisted upon Americans for profit.
title: Horrible, to the surprise of no one

review: There is no online appointment scheduling; so I personally have to call my provider while usually speaking to 3 different rude nurses and 6 phone calls just to schedule an appointment. The nurses are very immature and don’t look to deeply within medical records. I cannot change my pcp when hospitals and doctors make my appointment experience unacceptable. If I wanted to speak with a nurse then I would call the nurses hotline. Otherwise, just schedule the appointment so that we can move on with our own personal lives. The system is making it seem like healthcare workers are unreliable.
title: There is no online appointment scheduling

review:
Someone wrote a 3 star review a year ago saying they were deleting the app because it wasn’t going to carry Medicare advantage UHC patient info. 
Not so. I have that coverage and the app on my iPad mini works great. I can see my I.d. card and print it up. Of course if you are new to this coverage this year, there isn’t going to be a lot of info right away but enough info to let you know UHC has you covered. 
Thank you!
title: Really Good And Updated

review: Great app! Able to access the things I need regarding my insurance without having to worry. Fast access to my insurance card with the ability to email. Able to view my HSA balance. Able to see exactly how much has been paid toward or if I met my deductible. Each claim filed and broken down right in front of you. I doubt there’s a better health insurance app! Keep it up UHC! Glad to be one of your clients!
title: Accessibility

review:
I think the UHC app is one of the best. I like having my medical plan details at my fingertips. I LOVE the Renew Active program, and the only comment is: please bring back the calendar for the entire month instead of turning it off, or ‘hiding’ it after 10 days are completed - it’s fun to see at a glance the progress made throughout the month and compare with other months.
Thank you!
title: Renew Rewards Step Program

review: Okay, so although United States healthcare is a joke, this app really does help. I was completely clueless having to go back and forth on a claim, but now that I can get a rough estimate easier through chat or their option makes it a lot easier to navigate. The app is really self explanatory and makes navigating your plan really easy. Take it from someone who does have to go frequently!
title: Best app for understanding

review: I downloaded this app some time ago and never really used it until recently. I am extremely satisfied with the ease of access and all of the information available. Once I acquainted myself with the website I was able to see my labs, find an allergist’s with maps and co-pay information.I’m not one to write a review but I felt compelled to convey my satisfaction. I Keep up the good work
title: My review

review: This app is really great. Has all the information you need and it’s very easy to navigate. The main page shows your claims, ID card, account balance, among other bits of info. I also love the chat feature, or the request for a phone call. I’ve used both multiple times and haven’t ever had more than a two minute hold time.
title: Incredibly easy & convenient

review:
I hate this insurance now. I had a referral for medical treatment and it’s being denied wrongfully.  
If your doctor says they want you to see a neurologist and you get a test and it is with the referral unit we assume that that is what you’re supposed to do. 
I will like that has nothing to do with this website but it is hard to find everything and with both of those things going on I may make sure that I don’t get United Healthcare next time I sign up for insurance because not only is the website messed up the insurance is messed up
title: Not good insurance or website

review: In July was tracking my steps with this app, successfully. Beginning August 5, the app wouldn’t recognize my phone. Called tech support 4 times (not very knowledgeable) and each time the person did not know how to resolve the problem and had to put me on hold to read a manual or ask for help. One of those times was put on hold for 45 minutes then call dropped then another time for 10 minutes and I had to hang up. They had an upgrade 6 days ago and I wonder if the upgrade is not recognizing iPhone 12 or visa versa. Right her way, I’m not getting my 7500 step recognition and UHC should consult with Apple.
title: Shoddy Tech

review: I really like this app; it is user-friendly, organized, and has tons of information. I would love to see a video chat feature added to the nurse connect capability..would be great to be able to SHOW a nurse something rather than try to describe it! I think United has come a long way with their technology, and I really appreciate having all of my coverage info right at my fingertips!
title: Great app!

review:
Every single time I try to log in I get this message. When I try to create a HealthSafe ID it says one already exists. Okay fine then let me reset my password. I try to reset it and use the password I have written down as my HealthSafe ID (same one I tried to log in with)... it says please don’t reuse an old password. Okay I will use a different one. Log in and it works. Close app and this exact process needs to be repeated when I open it again every time.  

So apparently I don’t have a HealthSafe ID, except that I do, and the password is wrong, except that it isn’t.

Seriously disappointed that such a simple process has been made mind numbingly painful.
title: UHC now uses HealthSafe ID™

review: The ‘new’ design of the “UnitedHealthcare” app (a replacement of United’s previous “Health4Me” app) is AWFUL!  It does the opposite of what the release notes claim.  The design change actually offers a MUCH WORSE overview as compared to the previous design.  United seems to have succumb to the bad advice of some digital guro, drank the digital kool-aid, embraced this obnoxious trend within website and app design, and wrongly concluded that consumers want oversized pictures and excessive white space!  The size of pics and use of white space in the previous design was much preferable.  Making more efficient use of vertical screen space, resulting in a nice balance between list efficiency and visual appeal.
title: ‘New’ UnitedHealthcare Design = FAIL

review: I am not able to log into this new app. I can still log into the health for me app but it just tell me to use the new app but when I try to as advertised use my current log on information it won’t let me in. I have also changed my password and even immediately after changing my password and trying to enter I still can’t gain access. Why do you guys close down a completely fine app to tell me to use one that doesn’t work correctly. I wish you would have at least still allowed me the option to view my information in the old app.
title: Not working for me.
body: Hi! We value your feedback and are sorry to hear about your experience. Please reach out to us at uhcmobile@uhc.com so we can better assist you.

review:
I desperately need to create account so I can reach the “health benefits card” site, we hv No cell service 9/2/21, cannot register for UHC app. I need medicine that I order, supplies ect., this appears to be very good app, is without cell service are hitting dead-ends many places to receive service when we need it most~ 
Please add a “chat line”...I scanned card which came back w all correct info., but still said cld not locate. We are having sporadic issues with internet but not WiFi normally. It is a big mess, but it is a mess. Thank you!
title: Need chat/Catastrophic areas no cell service

review: My experience with the the customer service department has been less than stellar.  Agents are friendly, but don’t seem to know what they’re doing.  3 calls, 2 transfers to wrong extensions.  One lovely gal from Texas finally got me to someone to help.  He was great, but getting there was a nightmare.   Just now got a response about the issue via voicemail, but message didn’t answer all my questions. Tried to call back automated system wanted an extension that wasn’t left.  When I tried to explain that, it didn’t understand.  Got to leave a message.   I guess they’re a work in progress!
title: Automated nightmare

review: When you try to submit a claim, you cannot hyphenate your provider’s last name (this happens on the UHC website when you submit a claim online). I cannot switch profiles from the primary insured to dependent even though there is only one log in per family. If I am mistaken, someone let me know. I am surprised this app has as many stars as it does. Also, I don’t like how call-friendly everything is. Why isn’t email or text or online contact more visible and accessible if it is available?
title: I can’t quite stand it.

review: I would really like to understand how my doctor is listed as In-Network but get billed as out of network? I pick another doctor that says in network be he is also out of network! I should not have to call to find a doctor when it’s clearly listed on the web page. P.S. can it be more confusing than calling the doctor’s office and they state that they do Not know if they are in Network.
title: In-Network?

review: I’m really frustrated because I’m trying to look for mental health care providers specifically black female providers and it’s so annoying because the app allows me to filter by gender, language, and distance, but not by race. Just as a patient who identifies as a woman might be more comfortable speaking to a female physician, because of a belief that they may be more familiar with the way they move through the world and experiences specific to women, I as a black person would like to speak to a therapist who understands trauma and experiences specific to black patients.
title: Filters by gender but not by race

review:
I was in a serious accident and ended in the emergency room and today had a follow up and had to schedule an MRI. I called united healthcare to see how much it would cost and if it was in my network. 
She let me know it wasn’t and helped me find one near me and gave me a cost of what it would cost out of pocket for me. 

I am so thankful and she was human she wished me well and told me to stay in good spirits. Her humility was greatly appreciated.
title: Insurance Rep was amazing.

review: Every United Healthcare customer should download the app. It was obviously designed with the user experience in mind. I had a question about benefit coverage and had the answer within 5 minutes — that’s finding the spot to request a call in the app to the conversation w the agent and having my question answered. Incredible!
title: A must-have app!

review: The concept is good, but there are a few hangups. The good kind my concept is that it has all your information on your phone. You usually can download a PDF file to store on your phone. However there are a few glitches. Right now I can’t see anything that I’m saying into this phone. When I type I don’t see anything either. I tried to generate a PDF of my records and it didn’t work so nice try but it’s not there yet.
title: Usually works

review: This app keeps everything right where you need it even down to virtual cards! You can keep track of your HRA as well as how much you’ve paid per person into towards your deductible which is so nice when you have seven kids on it! Easy to locate doctors and care by provider type or location too
title: Easy to use and track all in one app

review: I use this regularly to check on claims or find a Dr near me. This app shows me who’s in my network and who’s available. I can go check my claims to see what’s been processed and what I owe. If you have UHC i highly recommend this app because it will make everything so much easier. You don’t have to worry about having a current card on hand because it’s in the app!
title: So convenient!

review: This is the best experience I have ever had with an insurance company’s app. Most offer a basic shell which essentially is useful for looking at claims or ordering cards. This app and the tools it provides are above and beyond the others I have used. Also, the benefits that UCH offers in my current plan are absolutely amazing. Well done, United Healthcare!
title: Blown away…

review:
I had Ucare before and it was such a pain to try and find a doctor that was covered by my insurance. It was even harder to find a doctor that show my costs.

I love that this app makes it very easy to find a clinic or doctor that is in network and it shows your cost averages for each service.
title: Super User Friendly

review:
Very convenient and easy to use app! I like the idea of managing my claims and viewing medical
services each provider offers. It is truly catered to the patients needs in a simplistic manner. I had the pleasure of locating all my current providers via app! Any service or coverage I am unsure of, I have the option to chat with a representative who will assist me in verifying my benefits! 
Nicely put together!!
title: Resourceful and quality

review: Several doctors listed don’t answer their phones which makes me wonder about the validity of the list of providers. I was recently told my prescription wouldn’t be covered by a pharmacy I regularly use. I couldn’t find a list anywhere that shows UHC approved pharmacies, and I’m not even sure why this changed. It’s so frustrating that I need a detrimental prescription before work tomorrow, and I can’t pick it up without shelling out $500 and there is nothing I can do about it.
title: Can’t find what I need.
body: We value your feedback and we are sorry to hear about your experience.  Please reach out to us at uhcmobile@uhc.com so we can better assist you.

review:
This is more of a ding on United healthcare overall rather than the app design itself. 

Why is there not 24 hour support for claims and coverage ? What if your customer is traveling abroad and needs someone to confirm coverage? That’s because health insurance is treated as a for profit business unfortunately. 

Not satisfied with this app until this functionality can be added. Just like they have 24 hour nursing staff(looks to be outsourced) , they should look into 24 hour coverage specialist as well. They make more than enough.
title: United healthcare needs more services

review: Makes you agree to stupid terms and conditions and set location every time you login to the app, even if you just want to look at account balances. Stupid design. In the time when every other app offers you to login using fingerprint, this app needs so many inputs. Seems designed by college students. This is despite limited functionality. Cannot do much with HSA accounts, cannot even see transactions. Clicking some buttons automatically open websites in safari without any warnings.
title: Terrible design and navigation.
body: We value your feedback and we are sorry to hear about your experience. We have shared this with our technical support team. Please send us your contact information at uhcmobile@uhc.com and we will reach out to you.

review: It’s great to be rewarded for getting 7,500 steps every month-but this year the app doesn’t show the calendar after the goal has been met. Some of us like to compete with ourselves to fill more of the calendar with steps-and see the cumulative number of steps add up. It’s a great way to set more healthy movement goals!! Hopefully you’ll bring it back!
title: Activity Rewards calendar

review: The day Sean from Health Insurance an Extra Benefits that could save me so much money every month, an he was right I chose UnitedHealthcare Duke Complete it just went into effect the first of May 2021 an I’ve already saved about $1,200 to all seniors you really should get on board just think how much money you could be saving. Thank You UHC .......Janet King
title: Great Decision

review:
If there was a means to communicate with United Healthcare by email for general coverage inquiries, I would have given the app 5 stars. 

The direct telephone options to talks with another human is a nice touch. 

Having access to an electronic ID card is nice.  I would suggest adding a scanning icon to the app   It could make it easier for physician offices to access the patient data when patient doesn’t have their ID card available.
title: Convenient

review: I’ve had many different types of insurance throughout my life. And this is by far the worst! !! They are a greedy, stingy and unhelpful. Not only is the insurance bad, the customer service is as well. They deny coverage any chance they have. And they will make you pay high deductibles and premiums. Not worth it!  Find something where you don’t have to dread to get the medical or dental help you need. No wonder people are always late on diagnosis. Because of the lack of coverage that insurances Like United healthcare offer.
title: Worst Insurance! If you have another option get that

review: The app is really easy to use. Much to my surprise and delight, I was able to schedule a virtual visit with a primary care doctor within 10 minutes and I couldn’t believe how it easy it was to set up and how great the visit actually went.
title: Much easier than you would think

review: Surprisingly good app, used it for teladoc function and it was seamless.  Good ability to share photos with physician and talk through issues.  Doctor send prescription straight to my pharmacy which was basically ready in 30 min so I could wait from the comfort of home.  Would highly recommend.
title: Streamlined process

review: I love this app! My husband has a procedure coming up and had a few questions about our copay. Instead of looking up the number and calling an automated service, we just clicked the option for them to call us and his phone was ringing 20 seconds later. A REAL person was on the phone with ALL of the answers!!!
title: Very easy to use!!

review:
Just like everything to do with United healthcare, this app is garbage. I have had nothing but terrible experiences with United. Their coverage is awful and no provider accepts them. 
They are especially awful for mental health services. None of my doctors accept them and I now know to avoid them. Good luck getting anything covered, they have a lot of hoops to jump through and eventually you will pay out of pocket after they deny your claims.  
Unfortunately my new employer used UHC for prescriptions and FSAs. 
This app won't even let me log in at all. Piece of ****
title: Garbage

review:
I’m finding it to be quite easy utilizing this app. Its user-friendly, it’s very detailed and it allows you to understand more about the treatment you’re going to receive along with the benefits that can be applied.

This app is a wealth of information and it saves you hours of hold time while waiting to speak to a customer service rep.
title: Well Needed

review: I downloaded this new app so I could locate specific providers for services I will be needing. Need to find new Dr’s & care now that I moved several miles from my previous location. So far this new app has been exceptional for me! Now I only hope to have good luck finding providers (new physicians), etc. Thank you for making this new app available!
title: WAY BETTER APP THAN PRIOR ONE!

review: I needed this app to easily look up drug prices/coverage for my plan. When I finally found the link and clicked it, the first time it instantly logged me out, and trying to log back in just gives “internal server error” which is the same thing that happened when I tried to do it through safari instead of the app. It’s been over a week between attempts with this same result. The second time I tried through the app it now just loads a blank page. Useless.
title: Can’t do the one thing I need

review:
UnitedHealthcare is a decade behind other insurers with this app.  We’ve only had the app for a few weeks and already notice some big misses...

•should be able to tap each claim to view its details

•should be able to tap deductible & copay amounts to view all the claims that have contributed to each category 

•should be able to view EOB for every claim 

•no list of covered services 

•unable to view policy

•unable to file a dispute, provide information, anything for a claim

•many, many features missing such as ability to access personalized information on a variety of health topics, eligible discounts on products & services for members, etc.

So disappointing having come from an insurance company that provides a comprehensive experience at the user’s fingertips.  We will certainly voice our dissatisfaction to our employer to reconsider when selecting future insurers.
title: Falls Very Short
body: We value your feedback and we are sorry to hear about your experience. We are always looking for ways to enhance your experience. Please send us your contact information at uhcmobile@uhc.com and we will reach out to you.

review: App has everything I want to know!  Claims. Statement. Cards front and back. Account balance. Find doctors.  Everything and it’s fast!  Never crashed once. It’s so reliable and easy to use with clean interface. No need to call customer service anymore.  Very convenient and makes my life so much easier. Thank you!
title: Find everything!

review: I absolutely love this app. I am all about connecting people with technology, and utilizing it for the needs of... well... ME! This app has created solutions to some of my “Adulting” needs, and made it easy and manageable to keep up with my health insurance. It takes out a lot of the old school searching through provider booklets and made it user friendly.
title: Easy as 123

review: This app is amazing! I’m not extremely tech savvy but this app is perfect! I use it all the time to see what doctors are in network. All of their information is right there, makes it easier. You will always have your card on you. I can’t say enough good things about this app. Keeps me updated and informed I love it.
title: Easy and very helpful

review:
The app doesn’t work well. I haven’t been able to get into my rewards for days. I don’t know if I will be able to get my steps recorded this month.
I haven’t been able to update my rewards visa card for months. For awhile I could go on my desktop and do it but that’s working now. Seems like tech support needs to do some repair.
It’s okay when it works but that’s not enough.
title: App Not working

review:
This app is excellent for viewing claims and finding doctors, but I would love to see a place for prior/pre authorization requests and the status of each request.
There is currently no place in the app or on the desktop site to see these requests; you can only call to get this information. 

Otherwise great!
title: Would love to see prior authorization requests

review:
I love having this app! Not only do I have a digital copy of my insurance card, but being able to track my HSA has been so helpful as we have bills come and go. 

Then the other day I had to take my wife to the ER in the middle of the night and it was so nice to jump on here real quick to find the closest ER that we were covered under.
title: Lifesaver

review: This app is so easy to use.  Everything is easy to find and the fact that the medical ID card is at the start makes it easy to locate.  I have worked with other companies and their apps for medical coverage are clunky and difficult to use.  This one is great!!
title: Great App

review: I used this app to schedule a callback in 5 minutes and it worked. I would have given a full 5 star rating if I had found my doctor on the list of networked doctors. United needs to update their list of network doctors. I found the dashboard very useful with all my health and deductible information at my fingertips. One suggestion is to add a list of vaccination history.
title: Convenient and Efficient

review: This UHC Application is so convenient.  If you need to show an office that the claim was paid.  Or going in the app to see what has been met of you OOP or what copay cost for a specific dr.  All this information is provided for you.  And the best thing of all, if you loose your card, there is one on the site.  So nice and easy to use!
title: UHC APP

review: App interface is cool and all very easy to use. However I scheduled my appointment at 3:30 pm and the doctor didn't call me back until the next day at 7:30am. I checked the customer service people every hour and while they were friendly they didn't solve the problem. They said they are backed up and busy. Maybe they are overbooking people? Don't know. Another lady said because of this craziness she will give me a free virtual visit credit for my next visit. Never received it.
title: Never using it again

review: I expect the best medical care for my family, as well as myself. By using this app, I can not only save my physicians to my profile but I can also see the ratings. Of course even physicians are human, and cannot please everyone. However, this app give a bit of information that can be very helpful.
title: Quality medical care is priority

review: I’ve had other insurance apps in the past but this one is the most useful app other than pulling up my insurance cards. It tracks my claims, help locate a doctor or clinic, gives Health recommendations and many other things. Thank you UHC for making this app.
title: App is actually very useful

review: I like this app. It’s straightforward and easy to use. I like that it can find providers around you and it lets you track your deductibles, lists your copays, and gives you estimates. I didn’t even know there was virtual care, but I’ll probably use that from now on instead of sick leave. I do wish it would let you add more than one UHC card, though, as my dental is through UHC as well.
title: Great start!

review:
We installed the app following the website set-up and kept getting an error message that the app could not access our information and to use the website instead. The website tech support was very helpful by researching the issue and discovering that our programs were not compatible and cannot use the app.

Any plans to give all the AARP UHC Medicare Supplemental Plans access? Having to connect through a mobile device browser is a hassle. Thanks!
title: App Won’t Work for AARP Medicare Supplement Programs

review: Quickly and easily access your insurance card and find providers. I will say only draw back is that I’ve found that their provider information isn't always accurate but I usually have luck and it’s great having somewhere to start. Never have any bug issues and it’s pretty easy to use.
title: Good app!

review: I downloaded this app and tried to sign in, but I kept receiving the “Oops, something went wrong” error message. Eventually the app said my login credentials were incorrect even though they were correct when I log in to the United healthcare website on my laptop. I kept trying to log onto the app and it said I had too many failed attempts to login so I had to reset my password. I reset my password and still was unable to login - I kept getting the “Oops, something went wrong” error message.
title: Glitchy and couldn’t even sign in
body: We value your feedback and we are sorry to hear about your experience. Please reach out to us at uhcmobile@uhc.com so we can better assist you.

review:
I have been using this app for only a month. So far I see it as a great improvement from the prior app but missing the communications section. I sent a message to customer service from my desktop, I got a response and I answered back. When I logged in to the app on my phone I was unable to find any traces of the communications with UHC. 
You must fix this. 
Thank you.
title: Missing messages.

review:
Trying to add my wife I for for a virtual visit. Calendar for birthday entry didn’t pop up. After all data was finally entered I get an internal service error. Log out and back in three times, kept getting this error. No where to send email in the Contact Us section. Also, why don’t you already have my wife’s info? 
Further, what’s the difference between this app and Health4Me from UHC? Lots of fun figuring all of this out with a sick dependent.
title: Very buggy

review: I like that it’s user friendly. I like being able to find a location for a doctor or urgent care or whatever I need easily. Being able to find medications and compare prices with different pharmacies is a very nice feature.
title: Easy to use

review:
Easy to navigate, and you can find everything you need within the network, and the insurance card is included, you can even use it on different devices.
You can chose a provider closes to where you live and or with specific field of specialty.
title: Very Helpful and User Friendly

review: I know I should always review all of my health information but often the inconvenience of pulling up the website and taking the time to double check everything makes me forget to do so... this app makes it so easy to review and check my information, EOBs and claim information!
title: Easy Access

review: I just started playing with this to review a claim and it’s so easy. And it was SUPER easy to call UHC Customer Care right from the app, actually the app got them to call me, RIGHT AWAY! And I can look at the claim on the app while taking to the customer care rep. How easy is that?
title: Easy to Use, Fast Access to Info

review: This app is well designed, comprehensive and integrated with its service partners like Teledoc, so you can do everything from one screen! It’s intuitive and designed around the end user experience! I hope my company keeps UHC for the long haul! Love the coverage, network and tools available to its members!
title: The best healthcare app I’ve used!

review: Very basic information quickly but more detail available easily and intuitively without having to dig around. Straightforward with no irritation or frustration, which is not what I’m used to in dealing with healthcare sites.
title: Like using the easy button!

review:
I like the app as it’s very easy to navigate. My only main complaint about it is, none of the doctors are updated. I’ve called a few doctors office to tell me they’re not taking new patients. 

Even calling the 888 number have given me the wrong doctors. They’ve given me urgent care, or pediatric doctors. When I’m looking for a primary care physician. I use to have united health care and loved that insurance. Now I’m starting to lose faith in this company.
title: Update
body: We value your feedback and we are sorry to hear about your experience. We have shared this with our technical support team, and will be looking into our provider data to ensure that locations are up-to-date.

review: The app has definitely improved over the past few months with adding explanation of benefit forms to the dashboard. It’s a good reference but would be better and rate higher if I could save or download them from the app.  I have FSA feds and travel for work so having to get on a laptop after seeing what I need on my phone is too many extra steps. I want to save to Dropbox then upload to FSA Feds - done. But I can’t.
title: Good quick reference
body: Thank you for your feedback, this has been shared with our digital team. While saving Estimates of Benefits is not currently available, we are always looking for ways to enhance your experience.

review: The app give me access to all the vital information I need quickly and in the palm of my hand. Lots more info on their site, but what you need on the go is on the app and fairly easy to find.
title: Easy access to the most vital information

review: I love to have my insurance info accessible, my son has health issues and I always have so many questions regarding coverage. The chat line is quick and easy. I don’t worry about fumbling through my purse looking for my ID card.
title: This app is helpful but I wonder why the out of pocket amount can not be seen anymore.

review:
The app is very good and recently added Vaccine Pass, which was lacking. But missed the mark on not including 3rd doses or boosters to Vaccine Pass. 

UHC claims it’s based on CDC ‘Fully Vaccinated’ definition, which only includes first 2 vaccines. Although, hospitals, travel, many venues and restaurants now require boosters/ 3rd shots. Nonsensical why Vaccine Pass would not include full vaccination status.
title: COVID 19 Vaccine Pass Miss

review: We love this app! We have 5 children so we use our insurance a lot, along with the FSA. You can view balances and claims will be up soon (as of 07/18). Also has a copy of your insurance card and email feature in the app, which makes it easy to send to your doctors office if you forget it at home.
title: Must have for families!

review:
I have used this application for several years. I find it very easy to operate. Most of the features are intuitive.

If anything, I would like to see the ability to fax your ID card. Sadly, many physicians still do not offer email as an option to you
title: Nice and getting better

review: Uploaded with ease. Quick access to up-to-date accumulations of deductibles and out-of-pocket info. Super easy menus for finding a provider in my area. Have not used that long but really like the ability to find whatever I need quickly and easily.
title: Everything I need at the touch of my finger

review: Great app overall. Hard to save notes in the Claim Details when the keyboard is in the way of the Save button at the bottom. Please move the Save button to the top or enable the keyboard to disappear when tapping outside the text box. 5 stars when this is fixed.
title: Move the Save button

review: My visit tonight was to check if a doctor is “in network”. First I had to download the app & set it up. I liked being able to scan the back of my card with my cell & that info instantly populating into the app.
title: Set up

review: This app has everything you need: copies of your medical ID cards, claims information, deductible information, etc. It’s interface is easy to use, and the chat feature is responsive and helpful.
title: Intuitive and convenient

review: When my job forced me to take your plan thru Walgreens I signed up like everyone else. I selected my primary care provider but you selected someone else and changed it again. When i call to fix it you tell me I have to wait 10 days beyond when my maintenance meds for blood pressure run out. Your response is see the doctor you selected. That doctor won’t be able to see me for a month.  I’m reporting you and UHC cause your putting my health in jeopardy.
title: Putting my health at risk

review: I am home sick today and I recently moved to a new city. I didn’t have a primary care doctor yet, and most clinics are full and not accepting new patients. Today, I did the virtual visit with a doctor and it was painless. I got to talk to a doctor from the comfort of my bed with a prescription being written! Love the app and it’s functions!
title: Amazed

review: All the information I need right on my phone, always current and up to date. Great response time to on line chat questions.
title: Always up to date and has all the data I need to manage my account

review:
Two things that could use improvement:
1/ in account balances, make history available for viewing
2/ in claims management, it’s not clear how to make notes; there should be more filter options; there should be a way to do something with the filter results- share or save outside of the app
title: Almost There

review:
No FaceID. It shows it, but it never gets enabled.

You get an email saying there’s an update to an appeal or a claim, go into this app, no where to see that update. Just cryptic, utterly useless info about claims that often don’t even reflect the actual end state of a claim (sometimes UHC will process the same claim 3 different ways over weeks and months so via this app or even their web site it’s nearly impossible to figure anything out… best to just call them).
title: Utterly useless app

review: Once I got an activity tracker that would sync with the app (a Garmin), it worked great ! It also took a minute to figure out how to navigate it, but again once I got the hang of it, I’m very pleased. Definitely would recommend this app !
title: Very Easy and Helpful

review: I have had UHC for 5 yrs through my employer so I have had this app for awhile and it gets better and better as well as easier to navigate. I highly recommend their tele med service quick and easy and doctor was super compassionate and thoughtful and thorough! 5 Stars
title: UHC App

review: This App has been Amazing to keep track of all my medical claims. Very user friendly and a great way to know if you are truly being charged the correct out of pocket by your providers. It even notifies me when a new claim has been processed for me to review.
title: So Helpful

review: UX/UI Experience is really flawless, Access to important and uncluttered single pane information and links to everything I have needed to access within reach, built in GPS for finding in network providers and support links make the UHC App a win in my book. Well done UHC!
title: Great App Experience and Functionality

review:
Hello all, 

This is one of the best health care apps I’ve encountered. One word to describe it. SIMPLE. Super simple to use. Everything is available at your fingertips. It is very user friendly.  10/10 would recommend not only getting the app but united healthcare as well.
title: The best

review: I’ve had two other health insurers in the past 10 years, both of which have made obtaining information on my coverage and claims next to impossible. UH provides timely information when and WHERE you need it.
title: Helpful information at your finger tips

review: Been using this to find a doctor. Searched by medical condition. It’s simply, flu/cold. The app shows pediatricians (I’m in my 30s and UHC obviously knows that) or doctors that either don’t exist or places that don’t even have any doctors. Walked 3 miles across manhattan from one to the next. Finally one office (where the doctor listed in the app only sees patio a up to age 25 even tho the app shows “sees anyone”) told me they have a doctor who can help me and is in my network. Weird how that doctor isn’t listed in the app. What a disappointment.
title: Shows doctors that don’t exist.

review: My interactions with UHC ios app has been flawless. I like the overall UI/UX flow and be able to find anything in few clicks. Being a software engineer myself I appreciate all the hard work that has been put into it . Keep up the good work.
title: Great app

review: I was happily surprised at how useful and user friendly this app is. It allows you to easily access you health and insurance info. It also makes it easy to look for providers.- Much easier than the website !
title: So useful!

review: I recently downloaded the app to sync my Fitbit to get rewards credit.  Thanks to a very patient worker when I called my steps information now goes directly to United Healthcare for my rewards.  I look forward to using the other features this app provides.
title: New to the app but pleased so far

review: I have logged into the chat feature multiple times. I spent an entire day being told they were closed, assuming they were having tech issues. I’ve spent another day trying to log in and talk to someone, only to be kicked out because “all agents are busy” when I get to the front of the line. I hate that my work switched us to United because trying to get information through this app is stupid.
title: Impossible to talk to someone

review: I used the virtual visit for the first time today. I  have asthma and was short of breath. A doctor called me within 10 minutes. He heard me out and diagnosed me soon after.  He sent a prescription to my pharmacy and that was all.  Very convenient and it was free for me.
title: Maria

review: I love being able to talk to someone while I’m at the doctor’s office. I can check on coverage right there. I can see all my claims in an instant. The layout is easy. I don’t have to through a bunch of redundant clicks to get what I want.

Easy menu’s simple questions, great for a great coverage companies. As for the tech side great layout.

UHC has transformed into a very user friendly enterprise that has made a focused effort to incentivize their customers to enhance their personal wellness.

Used this twice and both DRs were professional and were able to diagnose the problem and get me the proper medicine to resolve the issue.
Now my wife can’t tell me that I never go to the Dr.

review: I’ve used this app for several years and although the new version of it for 2022 has generally been an improvement, one feature I really employed is now missing. I use this app to participate UHC’s Renew Rewards step program. With the app linked to my iPhone’s health data my steps are recorded. However, in previous years my accumulative step total for the entire year was always available on my UHC account. Now, though, once I had earned my reward for the month all following steps for the month were not available. When I contacted UHC I was told that my tracker was turned off and I needed to sync it. However, there was no way to do this because Step Reward no longer showed as an available activity on my account, I assume because I had already earned it for the month. Further, my tracker was not turned off anyway. It will be interesting to see happens when next month rolls around. Having the ability see see how many steps I have walked throughout the year was a real motivator. My husband and I had quite a competition and made an effort working to pass the three million step mark for the year—not too shabby for a 73-year-old and a 75-year-old. But now that steps no longer register on this app once we’ve earned the reward for the month it’s not nearly as much of an incentive to keep active, which obviously is the whole point of the program. Although my iPhone records my daily steps and provides lots of other related step information, it does not provide an accumulative step total for the year, which is one reason it was such a great feature on the previous UHC app. PLEASE add this feature back into your app so that I can revise my rating to five stars!
title: Accumulative Step Total Now Missing

review:
I have found this app extremely useful in keeping track of all my claims; all 75 as a result of a hospitalization two years prior. 

Anyway, it’s appreciated that there is an opinion to narrow down searches based on criteria such as date of service, amounts owed, and alphabetical order, etc.
I like that individual claims to be marked as paid for our reference and can be flagged. 

However; what would be helpful is even more criteria options to narrow our searches and results. 
1) Options could include the ability to only view claims that are currently flagged. 
2) Claims by a particular person/provider, maybe even including a search bar that can pick up on words or names.
3) Claims up/down from to certain criteria, like amount owed, billed, or settled and claims found to be more or less than an amount set by us. 
Example: search for “amount billed/you may owe” claims that $500/+ or $7,000 and below.

It would also be helpful if each claim had a couple more options on how to make/separate them. 
Instead of just simple flagging a claim or checking the Paid box, perhaps more options such as..
a) ‘Watching/TBD’ for claims needing to be checked back on often or are important.
b)‘Re-processing/ disputing ’ for claims needing to be re-processed, or disputed, or being waited on for changes,  

And one last thing, it gets confusing when a on the complete list of all your claims, there will appear 2 or even 3 other identical claims but appear to have be reprocessed and May now show no balance owed, or that insurance has now covered the expenses. 
It’s very confusing having to match up each of these original and their new status doubles by scrolling up and down on a phone to compare claims or just in general.
Each claims has a unique # but it’s tedious to have to find the new claim to the original to confirm insurance had now covered the cost amount or that the claims been successfully reprocessed.

That’s why I say some kind of more in depth search option or sorting method would be helpful to find the particular claim(s) you’re looking for, quicker and without mistake, (like searching up an actual claim number as an option)  

Just some things that frustrate me when I use the app, and wish would be a little different or a little bit of improvement, some possible refining of already existing features. 
Otherwise, I can’t complain. 
The app is very usual, very helpful and I’m appreciate of its existence.

Thank you for reading.

The coders have completely fixed the tracker issues now! I can honestly say I love this app!

As of 3/14/2020 RenewActive problem with App has been fixed! It was very simple to connect the tracker on my with the program. This now makes it seamless, and increases the incentive to move each day! Thank you to the UHC mobile team for all of the work you put into this. I’m sure members like me greatly appreciate this!

I’m going to give it a 3 (up from 1) until I can test out how the tracking function works for the RenewActive’s rewards program. They have fixed it where that is now part of the app(I’m impressed), so I just want to make sure it can “actually” track my steps. I will change my rating when that’s done.

New-2/14/2020

It has been a couple of weeks and there is no progress on getting the app functioning correctly. When I login to the app it is still showing “incorrect, old” member I’d and group number info.

When I go to the menu, RenewActive is still not there as an option to choose for tracking steps. This is a feature that the United HealthCare refers their customers/clients to for their rewards program.

Old-This is the app that Renew Active uses for tracking steps for rewards with the UnitedHealthcare plan. Renew Active does not appear on the menu as it shows/says on the Renew Active site. So it appears this app does not function as a tracker. I sent this review over the weekend. I also complained that the app is showing the wrong group number and member id for me. The people at UHC tech support told me they are working “aggressively” to correct this as they have received many complaints and questions. 
Yesterday I received an email telling me to “logout and log back in” and everything should be fine. Nothing has changed so far. Please fix this app! I think it would really be a convenient thing to use!
